column1: looks to swing it away from middle stump, but it's full and down leg side
good length, slight shape away this time. No feet from the batsman. Defended to mid-on off the inside half
full, marginal swing away, comfortably tapped to mid-on
good length in the corridor, forward block
starts this outside off at a length, swings more than anything else so far, but the batsman won't play at that. Has been wide of the crease so far

squares him up but he's safe. Sticks to his angle from slightly wide of the stumps. Gets it to move away from a good length on middle stump. Dimuth looks to flick on angle, gets a leading edge that runs through the open point region
full and swinging in at middle stump, turned wide of mid-on with his wrists
good length, swinging away from the corridor. Nice shape on that. Left alone
bit of wobble in the corridor, good length. Nice start so far, but the right hander happy to leave
good length, slightly wide of the corridor, no movement. Left alone
128 kph, good length, wide outside off and swinging away. Left alone
128 kph, good length, nips away in the corridor. Big stride from Silva to defend this
back of a length at off stump, fishes away from the body and taps this to extra cover with no feet
good length, slants it in towards off stump this time after seven going away. Watchfully defended to mid-on
what a ball. Not too quick, 129 kph, but he draws him in. Angles it at off stump at a length, and gets it to straighten past the outside edge
good length, angled into the pads. Pushed wide of mid-on on the up
good length and in at the pads, no swing. Tickled off the inside edge. Fine leg has a long way to run to his right
good length, angled in at leg stump. Poked  through midwicket with soft hands
127 kph, good length, nice bend away from the corridor. Left alone
128 kph, full at middle stump, offers the full face and taps it to mid-on
126kph, length in the corridor, left alone
probing. Persistent line from Abbas. Good length outside off, but close enough to make him play. Defended off the outside half into the covers

outside edge through the slip cordon. He was in control of this, it appears. Pokes in the corridor on the front foot, but with soft hands. Gets it into the turf and through the gap between third slip and gully
back of a length at off stump, pushed to mid-off's right with soft hands
full and down leg side, into the pads. Can't get bat on his flick, it pings off the pad towards fine leg
good length at middle stump, taps it towards mid-off...takes off for a run and then says no. Nervous calls, but safe in the end
good length outside off, shaping away and he lets it go, only to find it nip back off the pitch
good length, shaping into the pads. Deflected fine off the thigh guard
nice. Good length in the corridor. The previous came in so Silva plays at this. Only to be deceived as this goes on with the angle, past his outside edge
back of a length at middle stump, watchfully defended
good length at off stump, half a stride to get it wide of mid-off. Tight single and he has to stretch as Aslam lets rip on the swivel. Doesn't hit the stumps
back of a length in the corridor, shapes away, left alone
good length outside off stump, shaping away, left alone
good length, too far outside off, left alone
good length, into the pads. Flicks it and takes off instinctively. Not so fast, says short leg. Quickly onto that and a backhand flick towards the stumps
good length outside off, left alone
good length, angled in at off stump. Dabbed wide of mid-on for the quick single
good length, angled away from outside off, left alone
the first bouncer of the day. Too short though. Silva comfortably under it as it flies over leg stump
good length, wide of the crease but shapes it in. Defended into the pitch
good length at off stump, nicely forward and defends solidly
beaten on the outside edge. Pokes at this back of a length ball on angle, but it straightens past his bat
good length outside off, angled away, left alone
good length outside off, thinks about playing that, withdraws at the last moment. Good call
back of a length at off stump, on the back foot to bunt this wide of mid-on
overpitched on leg stump, clipped straight to square leg. First boundary ball of the day, doesn't convert to the first boundary
and now the first appeal. Back of a length on leg stump, looks to flick on the up but he's beaten by how fast this skids on. Cops it on the pad, appeal is turned down. Pitching outside
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length, wide outside off. Left alone
back of a length, angles in at off and he leaves it alone on height
good length outside off, a nervous forward defence, almost withdrawing in the end, but he gets it through the covers
full at middle stump, squeezed wide of mid-on off the inside half
good length, in at middle stump. One hand off as he defends off the back foot
good length outside off stump, left alone
overpitched outside off, his eyes light up. Looks to caress this through extra cover but he's early on it. Bat turns, ball dribbles to mid-off
back of a length at leg stump, whipped wide of fine leg
back of a length at off stump, pushed off the inside half of the bat, past mid-on
goes wide of the crease for the first time. Angles it in at off stump, nips it away off a good length. Thick outside edge to gully
good length outside off, nips it back in a long way. Silva lets this go, having gotten used to the shape away. Close to the off stump
back of a length at off stump, drops it into the off side with soft hands and looks to steal a single. Sent back as mid-off swoops
good length, pushed through at middle stump. Slides and nearly traps him on the back foot as he defends
floated up generously, but he's down the track to take it on the full and drive to long-on
back of a length at off stump, pushed to the covers off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven to extra cover
good length at leg stump, hardly turn, comfortably defended
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length at middle stump, tucked off the inside half through square leg
overpitched on leg stump, good connection on the flick, but it's straight to square leg
bouncer. Nicely directed, but it's not the quickest. Pitch not zooming either. Silva ducks

nearly runs it onto his stumps. Silva has been overly cautious - taking his bottom hand off the bat often and playing with ultra soft hands. This time he's half leaving, halfway playing in the corridor. He's half forward too. Ball hits bat and rolls past the off stump
short and wide, overcompensates with a big slash at it. Beaten comprehensively
full at middle stump, gets to the pitch and flicks...straight through short midwicket. Yasir unhappy
length at middle stump, flicked to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, spins in sharply as he looks to back away and make room. Pushed to covers
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, makes him reach out to defend. He does it comfortably
was that the googly? He looks to flick this full one from outside off, gets a leading edge that rolls harmlessly to mid-off
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone

back of a length in the corridor, awkward poke as it straightens. But his watchfulness is the reason this edge doesn't fly to slip. Instead it's past second slip's dive and that's the first boundary of the match
short and wide outside off, doesn't' chase it
back of a length, too far outside off, left alone
good length, wide outside off, left alone
walks across his stumps as this spins down leg, misses the flick
length at middle stump, pushed through flat. Defended into the leg side
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, loops nicely and takes the outside half of the bat as he defends
length outside off, jumps down the track and gets the bat down quickly on this flat one. Taps it back to the bowler
back of a length at middle stump, tucked off the back foot to deep square
good length on middle, tucked towards the leg side to midwicket. It was rising on him
short outside off, angles into the left hander, glanced to midwicket once again. Forced onto the back foot
short outside off, shuffles to the left and works that behind square to midwicket this time. Slightly away from the fielder there, and allows them to run through
good length outside off, good bounce on offer, defended off the back foot from top of off stump
good length just outside off, left alone. Quick to get out of the ball's way
good length on the fourth-stump line, entices the batsman to try and have a poke at it, but he gets the bat back just in time. Flies just past his outside edge
full just outside off, dances down the wicket but plays down the wrong line. Spins into the left hander and raps him on the pads. Loud call for appeal but turned down
full on off stump, clipped off his toes towards deep midwicket , Early call for the second
a beauty! Full on middle, the batsman prods forward to defend it but sharp legspin takes the ball just past his bat's outside edge.
full on middle, slight legspin, punched towards mid on
short on middle, spins away from the right hander thus giving him room to cut that towards point for a single.
full on middle and leg, a mistimed front-foot defense
pitched full outside off, firmly defended back to Hasan. The bowler anticipates a run-out opportunity at the non-strikers, and flicks the ball back towards the stumps. He misses though
short outside off, shoulders his arms. Quick

and that's the first wicket! Full outside off and Kaushal wanted to leave that ball once again, but it's a quicker delivery, and he can't get his bat out of the way in time. As soon as he looked to shoulder his arms, did the ball catch his bottom edge and then ricocheted onto the stumps. The cautious opener has to go.
full outside off, no footwork from the batsman as he plays that towards mid on
full on off stump and angles into the left-hander, defended towards midwicket off the backfoot. Lack of footwork once again from the new man
full outside off, strides forward and defends that firmly off the front foot
short on middle, steps back to open his chest and muscles that onto the leg side off his backfoot.
full just outside off, stays low and hurries the new man. Gets his bat down just in time
tossed up full outside off, defended with the bat's full face.
full on middle, worked towards the leg side

full on middle and Thirimanne falls into the trap! Gets down on one leg and tries to slog that over midwicket but the quicker delivery raps him on his back leg. The infielders go up! And the umpire raises his finger. Two quick wickets for Pakistan, and the early pressure is now paying off. The ball would've broken middle stump
full on middle, defended off the front foot
full outside off, punched back to the bowler but the bat turns in his hand
full on off, worked towards midwicket off his front foot
short outside off, angles into the left-handed batsman, gets onto his toes and drops his wrists to play that safely. Falls near his toes
full just outside off, the angle into the body allows him to work that in front of square on the leg side
quicker outside off stump, pinches on a good length and Mendis carefully sees it go past him and through to the keeper
full just outside off, Hasan tightens his line slightly. Closer to the batsman's body but Mendis does well to gauge how far the ball was away from off stump. Shoulders his arms
tossed up just outside off, drift in the air and the batsman charges in to negate the spin. Hit slightly in the air behind square on the leg side
full on off stump, spins away from the batsman who defends it towards point.
full on middle and leg, prods his front foot forward and defends it
good length on off stump and turns sharply away from Mendis. He drops his hands to play that safely along the ground
full just outside off, drives it with the turn off his front foot. But straight to cover
short and wide outside off, eases the pressure but allowing Mendis to rock back and cut that in front of square. Goes between cover and point, allowing the batsman to take two
full on middle stump, the batsman shuffles and clips that off his pads towards mid on
good length outside off, once again the ball hits the blade despite him trying to shoulder his arms. The ball dribbles away to point. Quick stuff
and this time the batsman uses Hasan's pace well. It's full outside off and driven down the ground past mid off.
full on off stump, defended towards mid off

good length on leg stump, just straying in line and the ball goes was going down the leg side. The batsman can't get away in time, and neither can he get bat to ball, but the cherry smacks the thigh pad and races away to the leg side behind the stumps for four runs
good length on middle, punched to cover off the backfoot
full just outside off, the batsman anticipates the legspin and lets the ball goes through to the keeper
full on off stump this time, reaches in front and brings out a wristy drive. Not timed well, and finds mid off
fuller on middle stump, gets his toes out of the way and drives that with the bat's open face towards cover
full on off stump, sharp legspin, the batsman tried to defend it but takes the outside edge and flies - but along the ground - to point
full on leg stump, stays very low and this one's the straighter one. The batsman does very very well to get his feet back and get bat to ball. Yasir appeals, but umpire Llong says bat first
full on middle, hurries the batsman into working that towards midwicket
good length outside off, defended off his back foot
full outside off, the batsman lets it come towards him as he times a perfect cut. But it's straight to point
full on off stump, smartly driven but straight to mid off
width offered outside off stump, short and waiting to be punished but Karunaratne's cut can only find the fielder stationed at point. Two loose deliveries this over now.
short outside off and this time he finds the placement. Not cut as furiously as before but gently helped past point's right. Runs away to the boundary with no third-man protection in that region
good length outside off, punched towards point and calls early for one. Dive from the fielder and quick release back to the keeper, but the batsmen were easily in by then
good length on leg stump, the batsman charges down and works it towards the leg side
full on leg stump, glanced towards midwicket and quick call for one.
full on leg stump, clipped towards mid wicket but there's protection there
full on off stump, Mendis carefully defends that from in front of off stump
full on off stump, slight legspin and Mendis defends that with the turn
full just outside off and driven well to mid off. The batsmen take a run but Hasan Ali does well to throw that ball in. Breaks the stumps at the non-striker's but the batsmen were in.
good length just outside off stump, defends it off his front foot. Full face of the bat
good length on off stump, tries to clip that towards deep midwicket but mistimes the glance shot.
short on off stump and Karunaratne has to duck! The short ball comes in and takes the batsman with surprise but he was up to the challenge.
follows the bouncer, with another bouncing delivery. Karunaratne ducks once again. Short outside off stump
full outside off, slower delivery this time, played with soft hands in front of square on the leg side
good length just outside off, defended off the front foot to see off the over
short on middle stump, uses the crease's depth to rock back, and then works it off his pads towards fine leg for one
good length outside off, spins away from Mendis, who tentatively pokes at the ball as it passes him, takes the edge and flies towards third man for more runs
full outside off, defended with soft hands towards the off side
full on middle and Mendis charges down, wristy shot towards the leg side but straight to midwicket
full on leg stump, defended firmly
full and wide outside off, the batsman sees it go past him
full toss outside off, can't time it well and straight to mid off.
full on middle, good line and defended back off the front foot
full outside off, driven straight to cover
full outside off and left alone
full outside off, the bats face turns towards the leg side, as it  is driven to mid on
good length on middle, played straight back to the bowler

full just outside off but there's no spin. Goes straight on and takes the edge! Mendis tries to defend that off his back foot but the ball goes past his blade and takes his outside edge and through to Sarfraz. Sharp catch from him. And that's lunch as well
back of a length, slider on middle stump. Tapped towards square leg off the back foot
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length at off stump, defended off the inside half
close. Hits him on the back leg in front of middle stump. Would have been plumb had it pitched in line. Some turn for Yasir there, Chandimal was looking to close the face
length at off stump, inside edge onto pad as he defends
good length in the corridor, slight shape away, defended solidly
full at leg stump, nicely clipped off his toes, but straight to midwicket
bouncer, too short at an off stump line. Easily ducks
goes wide of the crease, angles this in at off stump. Back of a length, defended off the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, punched to mid-on on the up
mid-on misses the stumps at the non-strikers. Was an offcutter from Amir, well picked and flicked wide of mid-on from off stump. Hesitation as he took off for the run
tossed up at off stump, driven to mid-on
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at off stump, pushed off the inside half to mid-on
good length at middle stump, flicked to mid-on on the up
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length at off stump, pushed to mid-on's right on the up. Mohammad Abbas puts in a dive to keep it to one
bouncer slanted across off stump, nonchalantly avoided
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to extra cover
good length, angled in but too far outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven straight to mid-off
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven on the full to mid-off
floated full on off stump, firmly driven back towards the bowler who parries it to mid-off
tossed up at middle stump, flicked to mid-on off the toe-end
wide of the crease, aimed at off stump, but defended solidly off the front foot
short one at off stump, swivels and controls the pull to fine deep square
good length, angling in at off stump. Flicked through midwicket with soft hands
back of a length outside off, doesn't quite skid onto the bat as he punches through the covers. Picks up two
good length outside off, offcutter, stabbed into the covers
back of a length at off stump, poked to midwicket on the up
back of a length outside off, watchfully dropped into the covers
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
full at off stump, driven straight to extra cover
back of a length at middle stump, on the back foot to whip it wide of mid-on
full at off stump, gets low for the reverse sweep and just manages to get bat on it. So close, but its runs past first slip
short one at off stump again. This time no control on the hook. It's aerial briefly, but well short of deep square
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
overpitched outside off stump, driven straight to extra cover
good length, wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, big stride to push that through the covers
135kph yorker at off stump, dug out well in the end. Straight to midwicket
good length at middle stump, pushed back down the pitch on the front foot
length outside off, left alone
back of a length, spinning away from off stump. But he whips against the turn on the back foot, finds mid-on
good length at leg stump, flicked off the inside edge towards the fine leg boundary. Slip gives chase
full outside off, reaches for it and flicks between the two catching midwicket fielders. Long-on cleans up
good length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
full outside off, left alone on angle
back of a length outside off, angling away. Waits for it and chops it, very late, past backward point
good length, angled across, left alone
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, slight turn away, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, slides through from below knee height as he looks to cut
well bowled. Drift, dip and rip. Chandimal has no clue as he's beaten on the forward defence
this is challenging. Full at off stump, looks to flick against the turn without feet. Leading edge back down the pitch
full at middle stump, defended off the inside edge
full outside off, defended into the off side
full and angled into the off stump. Hint of late inswing there. Big stride across initially and nearly locked himself.Pushed to midwicket off the inside half
back of a length, angled in at off stump. Angled bat on this as he tries to whip it past midwicket. Gets an inside edge onto pad
overpitched outside off, driven back at the bowler
first signs of reverse swing. Beats the outside edge. Dimtuh unsure if this is coming in on the angle. Follows it with his hands as it goes away
length at middle stump, flicked to fine leg
good length at off stump, flicked to midwicket
good length at off stump, from wide of the crease. Dimuth gets across his stumps and looks to ramp this but it spins well down leg side. Luckily for him.
good length outside off, covers the stumps with a big stride and defends
good length at off stump, down the track and flicks straight to midwicket
full at off stump, flicked to deep square
back of a length at off stump, spins away rapidly and Chandimal prods away from his body. Thick outside edge past backward point
back of a length at off stump, tapped to mid-on's left and he steals the single to bring up his fifty. A measured knock that has kept them in the game
full and tailing in at off stump. An anxious push in front of his body, big inside edge to square leg
full at off stump, driven back towards the bowler
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, big stride to cover the off stump as he lets it go
short and wide, cut straight to backward point. Good transfer of weight
good length outside off, defended to short leg off the inside half
back of a length at off stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed to extra cover on the front foot
good length at off stump, left alone without covering the off stump
yes. Googly, back of a length outside off. Picked and defended off the back foot
full at off stump, poked to mid-on and the single is stolen as a livid Sarfraz screams
good length outside off, pushed on the up to mid-off
back of a length at middle, walks across and whips it through midwicket
full outside off, reaches the pitch but can't get the drive away. Straight to mid-off
looks for the bouncer, gets it woefully wrong. It pitches on leg and flies further down. Sarfraz stretches a long way
bouncer again, this one is at the chest but he keeps it down and finds deep square with the hook
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off, waits for it to turn into him and dabs it to deep square
good length, sliding at middle stump. Defended off the inside half
good length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
full at off stump, driven down to long-off...where Hasan Ali lets it through his legs and has to chase to pull it back
back of a length at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, pushed to extra cover
good length on off stump, spins sharply into the left hander, goes past his leg stump and the captain appeals for a caught-behind, but the umpire is not interested.
full on middle and off, driven straight down the ground to long on for a single
tossed up full just outside off, sedately defended off his front foot
full just outside off, he charges and flicks that to mid off's right. Quick call for a single and the batsmen scamper through
full on off stump, defended
full just outside off, punched straight back to the bowler off his front foot. Hits the toe end of the bat, and can't find the timing
full on off stump, slight reverse swing into the right hander, defended carefully towards the leg side
pitched short into the deck, on off stump and rises onto Chandimal. THe batsman does well to get on top of the ball and play it safely near his toes with soft hands
good length just outside off, Chandimal brings out the back-foot defense
good length just outside off, stays slightly low and forces Chandimal to hurriedly get behind the ball's line. Defended back to the bowler.
full on off stump, a nagging line that forces Chandimal to play at the delivery. Punched to mid on
full and wide outside off, no  swing and Chandimal can free his arms to bring out the drive. It's connected well but it's not in the gap. Straight to cover
full just outside off, defended
full just outside off, batsman charges and gets to the pitch of the ball. Whipped off his toes to deep midwicket. Enough time to walk through for the single
full on off stump, worked towards the leg side off his back foot for an easy single
full on off stump, dances down the wicket and punches that down the ground to long off
full just outside off, worked towards point off the back foot and calls early for one. Good strike rotation between the two
full and wide and Karunaratne flashes at that hard. Takes the outside edge! But there is no slip to gobble that up, goes away to third man for one.
short on off stump, angles into the right hander, who drops his bottom hand to play it softly towards the leg side. Smart cricket here, not letting the pressure build in this session
good length on middle stump, angles away from the left hander, left alone
pitched full on middle and Karunaratne clips that between midwicket and mid on to perfection. The ball comes into his pads and he smokes that for four. Textbook stuff. Well balanced
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off, left alone as the ball goes through to Sarfraz.
full outside off, the batsman reaches at that and punches it down the ground. But straight to mid off
good length just outside off, no spin on offer and he waits for that to come to his body. Opens the bat's face and glances it to deep point
full just outside off, played with the turn to mid on
good length and quick just outside off, hurries the batsman. Sharp spin into his body this time and does well to negate the dangerous delivery
short outside off but spins into the left-hander sharply, backs away and bunts the ball to long on
short outside off but too close to his body for the perfect cut. Cuts it anyway, and goes to point's left
full on off stump, defended

short outside off and Chandimal decides to poke at that. Too close to his body and takes the outside edge! but the ball falls just in front of first slip, takes an awkward bounce, and races away for four
full on off stump, driven to mid on
pitches it short on middle stump, Chandimal sees it coming and ducks
good length on off stump, Chandimal gets behind the line of the ball and defends it to point

good length just outside off, moves to the off side to get nearer to the delivery but plays it with soft hands towards the fielder at point. Learnt well from that hard jab in the first ball that almost carried to the cordon

yorker on off stump but Chandimal delightfully digs that out. Got down on one knee and squeezed that dangerous looking delivery behind the wicket and past short third-man for a boundary to end the over
full on off stump, dances down the wicket and drives to mid on. Well fielded there to stop the single
full on middle, worked off his hips behind square to fine leg
full on middle stump, gets his front foot out of the way and works the ball to the leg side. Straight to midwicket though
full on off stump, driven to long off and the batsmen run through
full just outside off, the batsman covers his line and then clips the ball off his pads to deep midwicket
full just outside off, uses his wrists to drive that square on the off side
full just outside off, no swing and straight through to Sarfraz
full outside off but uses the wide crease to get more angle into the left-hander. Shoulders his arms but this one was much closer to off stump. Well calculated by the batsman, I suppose
short just outside off, forces the batsman to get on his toes and defend it off his back foot
full just outside off, tries to drive that towards cover but the bat turns in his hands. Flies away to midwicket, instead
full just outside off, slightly slow this time and the batsman has to adjust mid-shot to soften his hands. Defended
full outside off, driven off his front foot but straight to cover
full outside off, driven to mid off and quick call for one. But he may be in danger! No, he isn't. Gets in before the ball reaches the stumps. Close call, though
uses the wide crease, full on off stump, driven to cover off his front foot
full outside off, he charges down the pitch (in fact, towards the ball), and works it down the ground to long on for a single
full on leg stump, awry line and it's clipped off his feet to short fine leg. The fielder slips while throwing it back
full on middle and leg, defended  straight to the player at silly
full on off stump, defended with the spin back to Yasir
short outside off, defended off his back foot but umpire Llong has his right arm out horizontally. No ball
yorker to follow that no ball, just outside off and while he tries to squeeze that ball out, it takes his outside edge. But falls just in front of the two fielders at slip
full outside off, tries to drive it towards cover but the bat turns and the ball flies away towards third man
a close call! Short outside off and his back-foot defense is not in the right line. Takes the inside edge, and almost into the stumps, but he survives. Goes to fine leg
full just outside off, allows the ball to come to him before playing it towards the gap in front of point. They have to hurry for the single, and they succeed
full outside off stump, but too close to his body for the cut. Takes an under edge and falls near his feet.
pitched up and fast (138 kph) just outside off stump, bunted back to the bowler
good length way outside off, but sharp turn into the left hander, worked behind square on the leg side from front of off stump
full outside off, backs away and cuts it. But straight to point
full on off stump, defended
full on middle and leg, gets to the pitch of the ball and works it to midwicket off his front foot
full on off stump, gets on top of the ball and defends it with the spin
full on off stump, driven to mid on and the batsmen are interested for a single. They decide against it
full on middle and off, the batsman gets behind the ball's line and defends it towards mid on

full outside off, played for the swing but there was none there. The cover drive is't quite there and it takes his outside edge instead. Races away between point and third slip for four. Only the seventh four of the innings
short on middle stump, climbs on the batsman who does well to work the ball to midwicket
full on off stump, carefully defended off his front foot
full outside off, front-foot defense into the pitch
full on middle and off but this one stays low. Hurries him into defending that from in front of his legs. Hasan reacts after seeing the batsman struggle
full on middle, offspin on offer, worked off his hips to short fine-leg
full on off stump, straight one this time and forces the batsman to defend
full on middle, defended off his front foot but straight to the bowler
full on leg stump, dug away to the fielder at midwicket
tossed up on middle stump, just enough flight for the batsman to get under it. Whipped past mid on and towards cow corner for four
flatter this time to adjust, outside off and cut away straight to the sweeper fielder on the off side
good length on middle stump, quicker ball. Gets onto his backfoot and clips it to the square-leg fielder
short and fast outside off, sends the batsman ducking for cover. Clearly surprised Karunaratne there. Batsman and bowler share a smile
good length just outside off, safe cricket from Karunaratne, defended to cover
full on middle stump, defended back to the bowler, who dives to his left to stop the ball. Saves atleast one
good length just outside off, stays low once again and forces the batsman to defend
full outside off, left alone as umpire Llong says 'Time for Tea'
back of a length at middle stump, shovelled through square leg off the back foot
back of a length outside off, defended in front of off, back foot
back of a length at middle stump, flicked at short leg's body
good length, wide outside off. Long stride, defended off the inside half
dropped short on middle stump, quickly back in the crease, pulls straight to deep midwicket
good length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length at off stump, flicked to midwicket off the back foot
full at off stump, defended back down the pitch
good length outside off, tapped into the covers on the up
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length, angled in at leg stump. Thinks he's flicked this past midwicket, but the dive comes out and he's forced back into his crease after taking off for a run
full and into the pads, turned past midwicket
length at off stump, pushed into the off side
short and wide, plenty of time to shape up for the cut, but hardly anything off the pitch to assist him with the power. He slaps it in front of square, but extra cover can chase and keep it in
full at off stump, driven straight to mid-off
length at off stump, defended into the covers
good length on off stump, forward defence
good length outside off, covers the off stump, lets it go
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, pushed to mid-on off the back foot

good length outside off, leans in and pushes it through the covers....Yasir swoops down and shies, rightly so, at the non-strikers end. He misses the stumps though and then mid-on misses the ball completely. Dreadful backing up.
overpitched outside off, nicely driven, but straight back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
short one outside off, but it spins back quickly and cuts the room as he looks to punch. Toe-ended to extra cover
full at off stump, flicked to mid-on. Who was long-on throughout the first two sessions
good length outside off, kicks it away
length outside off, takes a step into the off side, pushes it down the pitch off the front foot
good length outside off, gets low to try and ramp. Keeper and slip were both running down leg, but Dimuth cops it on the body and it lands pitch side on the off side
back of a length, spinning in from outside off, punched to extra cover
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length at middle stump, flicked straight to square leg
short and wide, climbing too, left alone
full and into the pads, caresses it past midwicket with a flick
offcutter, good length on middle stump. Pushed to square leg
good length in the corridor, well forward to defend it
length at off stump, dips on him and he reaches out to flick it through square leg
length at off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length outside off, mistimed punch on the back foot, straight to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, punched into the covers
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, tucked on the up to midwicket
full outside off, leans in for the drive, can't on this pitch. Gets it to mid-off's right with no pace
back of a length at middle stump, bunted behind square on the leg side and back for the second
good length at middle stump, defended to mid-on
offcutter, good length in the corridor. Defended to point
tosses up a dolly, full and wide. Bait is not taken, he's left it alone
full outside off, driven to point's left
full at off stump, flicked straight to midwicket
full at middle stump, can't beat midwicket's dive with the flick
back of a length at off stump, tapped to short leg off the back foot
full at off stump, pushed to short leg
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off,
good length, angled across off stump. Left alone
good length at off stump, inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, leans in for the cover drive, slow pitch. Inside half poke to mid-on in the end
short and wide outside off, shapes to cut, adjusts for the pace. Taps it watchfully to cover

he's run out! Here's the wicket and it's not the bowler's doing. Very average cricket from Chandimal, the non-striker. This was tossed up outside off, Dimuth stepped down to get to the pitch, tapped it wide of mid-on and took off for the run. A run which was there, and a run which he went for. It was his call, after all. But Chandimal is ball watching and has his back turned to him. Not even a call for no. The left-hander has reached the other end by now. Very unfortunate for him. Sarfraz waits after gathering the throw and absolutely batters the stumps. He's got his breakthrough
good length at middle stump, gets down and goes for the sweep. Top edge floats behind square on the leg side
length at off stump, forward defence

back of a length, ripping in at off stump from outside. He's back in the crease and struck on the back leg. Umpire says not out. They've reviewed. Height could be the only issue. There's no inside edge. Line looks fine too and he's well back...impact is umpire's call and so is the height. Not out. Review won't be lost.
full outside off, shapes to drive this, checks last moment. Pushed back to the bowler
hit on the pad as he goes on the back foot again, but this one is sliding down
good length outside off, big stride and defends into the covers
full and wide outside off, gets low to try and clatter a drive through the covers. Toe-ends it to extra cover
good length, angled down leg side. Pushed with the angle to fine. Was an attempted offcutter, 119kph
the perfect yorker. Wide of the crease, shaping in at off stump. Does well to get bat on it
offcutter, good length, outside off. No timing on the attempted cover drive
good length in the corridor, pushed on the up to extra cover
good length at middle stump, forward defence
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length at leg stump, steps down to flick against the turn, leading edge rolls into the off side
good length at leg stump, another leading edge. This time to point as he closes the face. He's looking very antsy
good length outside leg, spins and thuds into his pad as he pokes at it
back of a length at leg stump, turned to short fine off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
offcutter, good length at middle stump. Pushed to mid-on on the up
full and angled into the off stump, squeezed out to extra cover
another yorker. Getting some shape in, but unable to get past his defences
bouncer, left alone comfortably after thinking about playing the ramp
back of a length on middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed into the covers
good length at leg stump, pushed to square leg on the up
good length at leg stump, defended off the outside half to point
good length outside leg, spins past as he looks to flick. Hits him on the back leg in front of middle. Sarfraz excited instinctively before realising it pitched outside
length outside leg, kicked away
good length, pitching outside leg, met in front middle. Tapped to midwicket
short outside off, Dickwella prods forward and defends it
good length outside off stump, angles into Dickwella, defended once again from outside off
short way outside off and enough width to jab at the ball. Played to point and calls for a quick single. A direct-hit would've been out
full and wide outside off, frees his arms and caresses the ball for four. Driven beautifully and that's a delicious shot. Perfect cover drive
full just outside off, forces the front-foot defense
full on off stump, almost a yorker that forces the batsman to dig it out and back to the bowler
full outside off stump, Dickwella tries his stock-shot, the sweep, but goes straight, one-bounce to short leg
full outside off but plays against the turn, brings out the reverse sweep and sends it over first slip for a boundary
full on off stump, dances down and exposes all three stumps, but just smacks his pads while he tries to sweep

full outside off once again and Dickwella tries that sweep once more. The extra legspin means Dickwella can't sweep at it, and the ball is collected by Sarfraz. Is the keeper appealing? Yes, he is appealing for a caught behind. The umpire says no, but the keeper reviews. Nope, not out.
good length outside off, so much turn that it goes down the left-hander's leg side. Tried to paddle that but didn't eventually
tossed up outside off, less spin this time and Dickwella can sweep it from the bat's sweet spot. But, straight to short leg once again
good length outside off, comes into the batsman's body, who defends it off his back foot. Sent back to Hasan Ali
short and wide outside off, enticing Chandimal to cut and he can't resist. The ball stays low and goes under his bat.
good length just outside off, a nagging line and length that forces Chandimal to defend
good length on off stump, comes into his pads this time thereby allowing him to move back and use the ball's pace to clip it behind square on the leg side. Another boundary
adjusts the line right away, good length outside off but straight this time. Left alone
stays low once again! Full and wide outside off, Chandimal misses the cut as the ball goes under his blade. He played two balls this over for the bounce, and it let him down both times.

full on off stump, Dickwella settles down on one leg and sweeps that from outside off to third man. Slightly high on the bat, and perhaps a bit too much in the air as well, but there was no fielder there, except the three men around the bat
full outside off and sweeps it in front of square this time. Along the ground and to the sweeper fielder. Constant legspin on offer
full on leg stump, tapped to midwicket. No footwork
full on off stump, straightens slightly. Defended back to the bowler
full on off stump, driven down the ground to mid off
tossed up outside off once again and this time he times the drive much better, but the area is packed with fielders. Straight to short cover this time
wide outside off, on a good length and punched in front of square. Straight to cover
good length outside off stump and Dickwella pokes at it from near his body. Goes just past his outside edge
good length outside off, this time the batsman leaves it. Sarfraz comfortably collects
good length on off stump, uses the width of the crease and therefore angles into the left hander, defended off his backfoot towards mid on
pitched full outside off and Dickwella drives that with the bat's open face. Goes past point for a couple, and forces the infielder to give it a chase
full outside off stump, defended firmly off the front foot. Confident shot, even if it's for no runs
full outside off, spins away from Chandimal. Cut in front of square, but mistimed.
full on off stump, driven with the bat's open face straight to point
full just outside off, well flighted, defended towards point
short on off stump, and enough time for Chandimal to get under that delivery. Emphatically pulled over mid wicket for a boundary. He also gets to his 13th fifty in Tests
good length just outside off, spins away and through to the keeper
good length on middle, no spin, and bunted towards mid wicket off his back foot for a single. The second new ball is now due
good length on off stump, worked off his hips to fine leg for one
full outside off, tapped to cover and they call early for one. Positive cricket from Dickwella
good length just outside off, moves into the batsman but goes just past him and through to Sarfraz. The ball is beginning to reverse.
good length outside off, no swing this time and Chandimal shoulders his arms.
good length on middle, going down the leg side and Chandimal helps it along it's way. Goes down the leg side and Sarfraz has no chance to get to that. Flies away fine and for four
short just outside off, forces Chandimal to duck

full on off stump, spins into the left hander, swept once again but fine this time to short third man. Very dangerous single taken by the Sri Lanka batsmen. A quicker release, and a better throw, would've had Dickwella walking back
good length outside off stump, less spin and Chandimal lets it go
yorker on middle stump, biffed back to Yasir off his back foot
tossed up, drift in the air, lands on middle stump and driven back to Yasir
brings out the googly! Short on off stump, and spins into Chandimal. Smacks his pad as he looks to leave it, and flies towards the boundary, but no runs because no shot offered.
short and wide outside off, spins further away and Chandimal cuts to point
good length just outside off, pokes at it and sends the ball to point off his back foot. Needs a new bat, the bottom edge has chipped off.
good length on off stump, stays low and is clipped off his pads behind square for a single. Midwicket has to give that ball a chase
pitched full outside off, with two slips waiting for the edge. Chandimal drives and misses, goes between his flashing blade and the body
good length on leg stump, can't flick that behind square, raps him on the pad instead. Hit him outside the line, though
good length on middle, defended from top of off stump
slower ball, outside off stump, leaves the low-ish ball alone
good length on middle stump, carves it from near his body to point but the fielder does well to dive to his right and stop a certain boundary
full on middle, defended off his back foot
full outside off and Dickwella is quick to get in position for the drive. But point dives to his left this time to stop the boundary

good length on middle stump, backs away and works it off his hips towards deep midwicket. There wasn't two in there, but the batsmen ran hard to complete the double. A better pickup-and-throw from Masood may have had the batsmen in trouble

Is Chandimal out? Full outside off but Chandimal decides to shoulder his arms instead. Smacks him on the pads and the umpire agrees with the bowler's appeal for lbw. Gives it out. But Chandimal wants to review. It's missing the stumps, and not out.
full on off stump, straight delivery and that's comfortably driven to mid off
full on leg stump, in the slot to be smashed and Dickwella obliges. Whips it off his pads, and it flies over deep midwicket. It's the first six of the innings, and also brings up 200 for Sri Lanka
good length just outside off, prods forward and defends
good length just outside off, comes forward and plays with the blade's open face.
full and wide outside off, swings away from the left hander as he tries to drive. Takes the outside edge! But just wide of second slip. Four more, despite the false shot
full on middle, tapped towards short midwicket
full on middle and Dickwella misses the whip. Raps him on his pad and Amir appeals for lbw. 'No', says umpire Nigel Llong
good length on middle, driven wide of cover. Forces the dive
good length outside off stump, left alone
full on middle and leg, worked off his pads to the fielder at fine leg. And that's a fifty-run partnership for the duo.

good length on middle and off, enough room for Dickwella to punch that square. Flies over gully and it looked like four from the word 'go', but Masood does well to retrieve the ball. Saves two runs for certain
full and wide outside off, enough room to open his shoulders but drives it straight to mid off
good length on off stump, angles into the batsman. Tiptoes and glances it towards the sweeper on the leg side
short and wide outside off, no one at third man and Dickwella plays that ramp shot. Sends it over the two fielders at slip and no one can stop a shot like that
good length on off stump, rocks back and defends
good length just outside off, punched to cover off his front foot
slower ball just outside off, worked towards point but the non-striker shouts a loud 'no' for the run
good length on off stump, rises onto the batsman, takes the leading edge as he looks to work it towards the leg side
yorker outside off stump, perfectly dug out and sent to mid off
tossed up, full on leg stump, defended back to the bowler. Lack of spin with this new ball
full on middle, defended back to Yasir off the front foot
full on off stump, defended with the bat's open face

back of a length, pitches perhaps outside leg stump, spins across the batsman's body and hits him just in front of off stump. Yasir goes up to appeal! But the umpire says no. Sarfraz reviews after Yasir prods him but it's not out. Pitched well outside leg stump, actually. Pakistan are out of reviews.
good length on off stump, rocks back and bunts it off his back foot to mid off
good length on middle stump, moves back to make room but can only punch the ball to short cover
good length outside off, checks his punch shot, but it hits the bat's sweet spot. Flies past the bowler, and between him and mid off, and races away
good length outside off, straightens after pitching. Dickwella lets it go.
good length outside off, slightly overpitched and Dickwella is quick to pounce onto that. Driven square, between gully and point. Another four against a tired Hasan
full on off stump, prods forward and defends
full outside off, slightly slower and lower. Dickwella knows there's only two more balls from Hasan tonight and lets it go
short outside off, shoulders his arms as Hasan (presumably) is done for the day
full on off stump, driven off his front foot to mid on
full and wide outside off, spins away from the right hander, left alone

tossed up, flighted on off stump, plays with soft hands and calls for a quick single. Short cover races in and releases the ball quickly, but the throw was slightly wide for Sarfraz. Sri Lanka batsmen will be breathing a sigh of relief
full on off stump, spins into the left hander, too much spin and goes down the leg side. Tried to sweep but missed. Sarfraz is interested for a caught-behind. No.
full on leg stump, played to midwicket and there's a slight mix-up, but they decide against the run.
full on off stump and defended. That's stumps.
length outside off, moves away after pitching, left alone
length outside off, forward to defend as this keeps low
good length, wide outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, forward and defended solidly
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
length outside off, nice flowing drive, but he's hit it straight to extra cover on the bounce
full at middle stump, looks to drive on the up, doesn't get to the pitch. Turned to square leg off the inside half
back of a length at leg stump, tapped behind square off the hips

edged! Flies past second slip. Back of a length and slanted across the corridor. No feet from Dickwella. Very awkward push at it in front of his body. A good healthy edge that would have been waist height for third slip
back of a length in the corridor, and this time he lets it come and slices it late to deep point...comes back for the second and brings up his fifty
full outside off, driven with an open face to deep point
good length, in the corridor. Slight swing away. Squares him up as he defends off the high, outer half of the bat
good length, angles in off the pitch, but well outside off. Left alone
beauty. Back of a length in the corridor, climbs at him. Uncharacteristic of this pitch. Once again, he fends with hard hands. This time he's beaten
good length, in at off stump. Defended down the pitch from the crease
back of a length outside off, skids through at about knee height. Dickwella leaps to reach out and half-crouches as he makes contact on this. Runs it through the gap in the cordon
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
short and wide outside off, on his toes this time to get on top of the bounce, before scything it square on the off side. Point dives to his right and gets a hand on it
length outside off stump, left alone
short and wide outside off, stabs at it away from the body, gully dives to his left, stop it
back of a length outside off, taps it into the big gap between cover and gully
good length outside off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, punched to mid-off
full and angled in at leg stump. Stands tall and flicks his wrists to get this past midwicket
offcutter, good length at off stump. Picks it and uses the angle to nudge this to deep square
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off stump, no feet as he looks to crash it through the covers. Barely gets any bat on it
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off
good length, angled in at middle stump. Pushed to midwicket
good length at middle stump, defended with the full face
full at middle stump, can't get timing on the on drive
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, nudged towards deep point
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, forward defence
full outside off, steps out and taps to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
full at off stump, drives inside-out to extra cover
full outside off, toe-ends the attempted cover drive
good length, down leg side. Stands up to try and swat this behind square leg. Can't connect on it
back of a length in the corridor, pushed on the up to mid-on
good length in the corridor, tapped on the up to short extra cover
good length at off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
full and into the pads, tucked to fine leg's left
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, nearly taps this into short leg's pouch off the back foot. It lands short though
full at leg stump, swept straight to short fine leg
back of a length, sliding across the corridor. Tapped back to the bowler
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at middle stump, tapped to deep square leg off the back foot
good length outside off, left alone as it spins past him
good length outside off stump and very crisp, well-timed square drive. Straight to deep point
good length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
back of a length in the corridor, rises on him and he adjusts to defend to point
back of a length outside off, handsome looking punch on the up, but can't beat extra cover's outstretched left hand
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
back of a length in the off stump, punched to mid-off on the up
tossed up at off stump, steps out and drives to long-on
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side on the up
good length at off stump. Drops it in front of point with soft hands. Yes-no-yes-no-noooooo. The fielder did well

crunched through the covers. At long last, he gets one away through the covers. It's such a slow pitch, so it took real effort to put this away. Although it was in the slot, tossed up at off stump. Nice shape, good flow of the bat and sent to the deep extra cover boundary
length outside off, left alone
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the inside half
short and into the body, swivels and turns it to fine leg
bouncer, too short, easily left alone as it climbs over his left shoulder
another bouncer. Again, too short on a slow pitch. No trouble as he ducks this
back of a length in the corridor, pushed into the leg side off the inside half
short one, angling down leg side. Dickwella in poor position as he tries to dab it to fine leg with a hook. Beaten. That was close to the edge
short and wide, sliced to deep point
good length, wide outside off, gets it wide of short third man with a reverse sweep
short and wide, plenty of time to slap this to the cover boundary. Panic stations, Pakistan.
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
length at off stump, forward block
back of a length outside off, looks to cut, changes his mind.Taps it into the pitch
back of a length outside off, stays low as he shapes for the cut. Chops it into the off side
short one in the corridor, shovelled comfortably with an angled bat to deep square
short one, climbing over leg stump, ducks under it
good length outside off stump, nicely behind it to defend
good length in the corridor, pushed into the off side
yorker at middle stump. Good set up, but Chandimal keeps it out. had been shuffling to cover for the off stump line, and was mostly on the back foot the last two overs. Squeezes it wide of mid-on
bouncer, too short, left alone. Couldn't hit that if he wanted to
full at middle stump, pushed to mid-on
full at off stump, driven to extra cover
length at off stump, forward defence
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
big turn. Drifts in at a length on off stump and spins wildly past the outside edge as he pushes forward
full on leg stump, into the pads as he looks to flick. Perhaps an inside edge on that too
full outside off stump, driven back towards the bowler
good length at off stump, tapped to deep point
back of a length at middle stump, shovelled off the hips to fine leg's left

oh glorious shot. He's laboured hard to be able to understand this pitch and play one on the up like that. This is good length, coming into the corridor. Not too much pace or bounce on this. He hits through the line, high elbow, full face and gets it wide of mid-off. Superior shape on that too. Classy
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the up
length at middle stump, tucked to midwicket on the up
full outside off from around the wicket, gets right down and plays a controlled sweep to deep square
full at off stump, driven back at the bowler
nearly chips it to short extra. Full outside off, goes for the big drive again, it falls short
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the inside half. This one skid through straight
back of a length at middle stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
full outside off, mistimed drive to mid on. Bat turned in his hand
full on off stump, driven down the ground
full outside off stump once again, caressed to a diving mid off for one
back of a length outside off, Chandimal shuffles to his right and gets inside the line of the ball, worked towards midwicket off his hips
good length outside off, backfoot punch to cover
back of a length outside off, swings into the batsman's body. Gets on top of it and drops his bottom at the last moment. Well defended
full outside off, spins into the left-hander's body, worked off his pads towards the leg side

tossed up outside off and Dickwella cannot resist the sweep. Gets his front foot forward and slogs that on the leg side. It's in the air! But safe. Falls just in front of the sweeper-fielder on the leg side
full just outside off, bat-pad as Dickwella attemps the front-foot defense.
short way outside off, Dickwella frees his arms after rocking back into his crease. Cut away past point for a couple.
wide outside off and Dickwella tries the reverse sweep this time. Gets into a kind of a tangle, though. Unconvincing shot to the left-hander's short third man
good length outside off and Dickwella's eyes light up. Charges down the wicket and plays the on drive. In the air but safely between midwicket and a wide mid on. An expensive end to the over
good length just outside off, drifts into Chandimal. Defended off the back foot
full and wide outside off and Chandimal clatters that. Brings out the square drive but not enough power to go to the boundary
good length just outside off, gets into the line of the ball and works it off his pads towards midwicket
short and wide but comes into the batsman's body after pitching. Cut towards point but it was too close to his body for Chandimal to generate any pace or direction
full outside off, slight swing in and driven to mid off
full on off, driven to mid on off the front foot
full on off stump, prods forward and defends with a big front-foot stride

full outside off and this time he times the reverse sweep. Plays it square on the left-hander's off side this time and goes past the point fielder who was positioned slightly finer for that very shot.
the reverse sweep once again, flatter outside off but Dickwella can't time it well enough this time. Plays it finer towards short third man
drift and spin on offer, tossed up outside off and spins away from Chandimal. Lets it go

Yasir pitches it short, and it's wide outside the off stump. Chandimal gets into position early, putting is front foot way outside the leg stump, and then thwacked that off his back foot past cover for four
flighted outside off and Chandimal drives that on the up. Had the Potential for another boundary but straight to short extra cover

Hasan Ali with the breakthrough! Good length outside off stump, the angle gets the ball into his body. Tries to glance that towards third man with the angled bat, but it stays slightly low and he inside edges it onto his off stump. Dickwella looks distraught
pitched full outside off, mistimed drive towards the off side. No feet movement there
full outside off and a hint of reverse swing on offer, he had to bring his high back-lift down very quickly. Opens his bat's face and attempts to play that towards first slip
full outside off, punched off the front foot towards mid on
full on off stump, bends his knees and defends it from top of off stump.
pitched short on off stump, he ducks underneath, rather unconvincingly. Very little footwork
full on leg stump, clipped off his toes past midwicket for a single
full on middle and leg, worked towards the leg side
full on middle, defended in front of off stump
full outside off, gets his front foot forward and defends
good length on off stump, Dilruwan thinks about poking at it, and finally decides to let it go
short but quick and straight on middle stump, hurries the batsman and he somehow manages to get bat to ball. Yasir lets out a big groan, knowing fully well that he almost had his man plumb in front
full outside off, punched off the front foot past a chasing mid off
full outside off, Chandimal keeps his eyes on the ball while defending that off his front foot
back of a length just outside off, rocks back and defends from chest height
full just outside off, tails slightly in and allows the batsman to work it behind backward square. That's the team 300.
full outside off, no swing this time and easily defended
full just outside off, brings out the front foot defense to see the over out
tossed up full outside off, driven down the ground to mid off

full on off stump and it's the straight one this time. Gathers pace after delivering and goes past Dilruwan's bat and onto his front pad. Yasir appeals quickly and the umpire raises his finger. And Dilruwan reviews immediately. Yes, it's a big deflection off the bat's inside edge before hitting his pads. A deceptive googly there
good length just outside off, spins away and punched to short cover
tossed up full on off stump, carefully defended off his front foot.
short outside off and he gets into position early. Too early in fact: misses the pull completely as the ball keeps slightly low
flighted on middle stump, gets his front foot forward and defends it off his front foot
short outside off, Chandimal gets on top of the ball and defends that off his back foot
full outside off, driven through cover for two more. Moves onto 95
full outside off and frees his arms to cut that past point. Misfield by Yasir there and concedes an extra run
full outside off, shifts his body weight forward and defends it towards short cover
back of a length just outside off, Chandimal defends. Remains patient
slower ball just outside off, gets inside the line of the ball and punches it down the ground to mid on
flighted on off stump, drifts into the right hander, front-foot defense
full on leg stump, defended towards mid on
full just outside off, big stride forward and defended
flighted outside off stump, drifts in but defended
short outside off but gave it a big rip this time, spins slightly away from Dilruwan but can't put it away. Cut to short cover
quicker ball to end the over, straight one on off middle stump, hurries the batsman, who does well to get bat to ball. Dribbles away to midwicket
full outside off, defended back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, shoulders his arms
full outside off stump, angles away from Chandimal, who lets it go
That's the hundred! Full on off stump and Chandimal plays an expressive cover drive. Full followthrough on that shot, and that races past extra cover for four. His ninth Test century.
back of a length outside off stump, worked towards midwicket off his back foot
slow and full outside off, a sort of knuckleball. Lets it go
full on off stump, stays low but turns sharp anyway, just past his outside edge as he tries to defend
back of a length on middle stump, tries to work it off his hips but straight to short leg
short on middle stump, punched back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, flighted and goes just past Dilruwan's prodding outside edge
full on off stump, defended
tossed up just outside off, defended towards cover. That's 29 balls for Dilruwan and he's still on zero.
Full on off stump, biffed back to the bowler off his back foot
short outside off, rocks back and punched. But straight to cover
full on off stump, defended with soft hands
full on leg stump, worked towards mid on and calls early for one
full on middle stump, hurries him but manages to work that towards mid wicket

Is Dilruwan lbw? No he isn't. Full on middle and it straightens on pitching. No spin and that smashes him on his front pad. The umpire says out, but Dilruwan reviews. The third umpire checks ultra-edge.First visuals suggest that there may be a feather from his bat's inside edge. Not sure if that's conclusive, but enough for the third umpire. Dilruwan survives.
full on leg stump, glances it fine down the leg side and the fielder inside the circle has to give it a chase
back of a length but wide outside off, frees his arms and cuts it in front of square. Could've been three but they seem content with two
full on middle, offspin, worked to Yasir Shah at midwicket, who dives to his right and defends
good length on middle, extra bounce after pitching, carefully played to the leg side
full on middle and off, driven down the ground to Shafiq
full on middle, worked off his toes to the fielder at backward square
full on off stump, front foot forward and driven straight to short cover
He's off the mark! Charges down the ground and plays that over midwicket's head from middle stump. Almost gets to the boundary but the fielder retrieves that before it hits the rope
good length just outside off, cut from close to his body to the sweeper fielder. Chandimal looks exhausted.
pushed full on leg stump, goes down the leg side as he misses the sweep
good length outside off, cut to point and calls quick for one. Hasan Ali throws it in quickly at the non-strikers but the bowler can't grab hold of it
full on middle stump, brings out the on drive to mid on
full on leg stump, no footwork but worked easily off his pads to backward square
full on middle, tapped to midwicket off the front foot
good length on middle stump, prods forward and clips it off his toes. But straight to midwicket once again
full on off stump, carves a drive out of a ball that was close to his body. Dribbles away to mid off
good length on leg stump, gets inside the line of the ball and punches that back to the bowler
good length on leg stump, spins into the right hander, who glances it towards point. And that's lunch. Dilruwan congratulates his captain as they walk off.
back of a length at middle stump, tucked to fine leg off the back foot
good length at off stump, inside edge onto pad as he presses forward
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at middle stump, whipped past mid-on off the back foot
short and wide outside off, looks to cut, beaten as it bounces sharply
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length, in at leg stump. Flicked past square leg
good length at middle stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length at leg stump, tapped to midwicket
full outside off, leans in and gets the drive wide of mid-off
good length in the corridor, slanting in, defended off the inside edge

oh that looks very close but Pakistan have no reviews. Offcutter comes in sharply from a good length as he pokes forward to defend. Sneaks past the inside edge and strikes him on the back leg. Big appeal is turned down. Nigel Llong probably thought that struck him outside off. We'll see...hit him in line but only marginally. It would've remained not out on umpire's call
short and wide, bounces over the attempted cut
good length at off stump, driven to short extra
back of a length at off stump, punched through the covers
short and wide, chopped off the thick outside edge through the short third man region
good length outside off, dabbed to short third man off the outside edge as he pushes forward
full on off stump, driven to long-off
good length at off stump, pushed to mid-on
good length outside off, driven straight to extra cover
oh lovely. Picks this full one from off stump and neatly whips it past square leg
back of a length outside off, skids low, beats the under edge on the cut
good length in the corridor, defended towards gully with an open face
good length outside off, mistimed cover drive, back at the bowler
full and wide outside off, driven to short extra cover. One of two stationed there but he can only parry it to mid-off
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, tapped to extra cover
good length at off stump, defended to short extra
short and wide outside off, there's no one at point and he slaps it through there
full at leg stump, driven straight to mid-on
good length at middle stump, flicked wide of mid-on
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
inside edge into the back leg. Angled bat as this length ball comes into him, chops it on
good length outside off, driven to short extra
tossed up at leg stump, squeezed to mid-on
full at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
full at leg stump, flicked past midwicket
back of a length outside off, no turn, but extra bounce as he goes on the back foot to defend
back of a length outside off, no turn, but extra bounce as he goes on the back foot to defend
length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length, angled in at off stump and keeps low. Tapped to midwicket off the toe-end
offcutter, rips back in like a Murali offspinner from a length. Tucked past square leg with a closed face. Well adjusted
yorker just outside off, dead bats it back to the bowler
bouncer at middle stump, ducks under it
good length at off stump, forward block
full at leg stump, flicked to short fine leg
full outside leg, tickled to deep backward square
good length outside leg stump, pads it away
good length outside leg, pads it
length outside leg, no shot offered
length outside leg, no shot offered
length and swinging in at off, defended to extra cover
good length, swinging in, defended off the inside half of the bat
short and wide, barely reaches the batsman, who nearly chops this onto the stumps with a cut
overpitched on leg stump, clipped through midwicket and wide of deep square leg
yorker on leg stump, defended into the leg side
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length at leg stump, defended on the front foot
good length, leg stump, forward block
length at leg stump, soft-handed block
full outside leg, dabs a sweep, straight to short fine
length outside leg, padded away
length at leg stump, pushed through midwicket
length at leg stump, defended to midwicket
full and slight swing in from outside off, driven to mid-off
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full toss outside off, punched to extra cover
good length, tailing in at leg stump. Flicked to square leg
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length at leg stump, defended down the pitch
full at leg stump, pushed to midwicket
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length at leg stump, cops it on the pad as he looks to nudge it behind square
good length at leg stump, pushed down the pitch
good length at leg stump, pushed through square leg off the front foot
short and wide, looks for an expansive slice through the off side. Not on this pitch. Beaten.
back of a length outside off, cut to backward point
offcutter, length outside off. Looks to drive through mid-off, no feet. Beaten by pace too. Inside edge rolls out to deep square
good length, defended with an open face
good length outside off, pushed to extra cover
offcutter, good length outside off, looks for the drive and gets an inside edge to fine leg
good length at leg stump, defended on the front foot
good length down leg side, no shot
edged past first slip. Short and wide outside off, a feeble attempt at a cut. Flies past slip's outstretched right hand
oh hello. Jumps to get low and pick this length ball from leg stump with a reverse sweep. No one at point
and another reverse sweep. Just gets it past deep-ish point. This one is aerial and dipping low to his left, beats him
is this the switch? Steps out, meets the ball at a good length and lofts it over mid-off. Not fully controlled, but hit well enough
full toss outside off, punched past mid-off and his dive isn't enough
short one outside off, ducks under it
bouncer outside off, left alone again

almost chips it to extra cover. Hasan Ali's offcutter is proving very handy. That's the third time in two overs that they haven't picked it. An attempted cover drive again, this time there's no inside edge
another offcutter. Defended off the inside edge this time
big appeal but this may have been going down. Slight hint of inswing from and traps him in front of middle stump as it angles down
full on off stump, defends the first ball after the break
fullish outside off stump, bends his knee and cuts it. But straight to point
good length on middle, charges down the pitch and drives with the straight bat to mid on
full on leg stump, charges and effectively yorks himself in front of leg. Does well to squeeze the ball out
a loose ball, wide outside off, cut between point and cover for two more
tossed up full just outside off, comfortably defended off the front foot. No risk
full just outside off stump, defended off his front foot
good length just outside off, defended off his back foot
just misses the yorker length on leg stump, clipped off his toes to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
short on middle, raps him on the pads in front of leg stump. Amir appeals, but the umpire reckons it was going down the leg side
full just outside off, driven back to the bowler
full on middle, driven into the pitch, and over the bowler's head. Mid on runs across and retrieves
full outside off, no spin and easily cut to the sweeper fielder. They walk through for one
good length on middle, charges down the pitch and plays with the turn down the ground. Goes past the non-striker, and the diving mid-on fielder for four
full on off stump, driven with the bat's open face to cover
full and wide outside leg stump, tries the sweep but misses it as the ball goes down the leg side
full on leg stump, misses the sweep again but the shot wasn't in front of the stumps
full and wide outside leg, spins slightly into the batsman, but misses the shot once again
full on off stump, played with soft hands towards cover
full on middle, slightly slower this time. Uses his wrists to play it to midwicket
wide outside off, slower and stays low as well. Goes under the batsman's blade through to Sarfraz
good length on middle stump, he's dropped his pace in this over, worked off his hips into the gap behind square
good length just outside off, leaves
yorker on middle stump, does well to get his toes out of the way and jams his bat right in time
full just outside off, uses the reverse sweep to slog it over point. Rather safe
good length on middle, charges down the pitch and dispatched! Flies over long off for six

Stumping chance? The batsman charged down and missed his slog. Sarfraz was quick to dislodge the stumps but is Dilruwan in already? The bat seems to have bounced before the popping crease and then into the crease. He should be okay, but the final decision rests with the umpire. Not out, decides the third umpire.
good length just outside off, too close to his body for the cut. Sharp collection from Sarfraz
good length just outside off, backs away and cuts to point. Not timed well
back of a length just outside off stump, rocks back and punches it through cover for a single
slower ball to start the over, full on off stump, defended with soft hands off the front foot
short ball on off stump, not the pace to bother a set batsman. Ducks and gets out of the way
good length just outside off, opens the bat's face and taps it towards gully
back of a length on off stump, angles into the right hander, worked off his waist to midwicket
slower ball outside off, drives it on the full toss, straight to Masood at point
good length on off stump, driven down the ground to mid off
good length on off stump, too close to his body to free his arms. Biffed back to the bowler off the high part of his bat
back of a length just outside off, driven off his back foot to deep extra cover

full on middle stump and Dilruwan misses the slog-sweep. Hits his pad in front of middle and leg. Haris Sohail appeals! And the umpire says out! Dilruwan reviews straightaway. Replays show it pitched in line and straightened. Hit his back leg. This time there's no edge on UltraEdge. HawkEye says pitched on middle, struck him on middle and would've broken leg stump. Maiden wicket for the debutant! Dilruwan has to go.
full just outside off, defended off the front foot
full just outside off, prods forward and defends again
full on off stump, spins into the left hander, tries to sweep but takes his thigh pad instead. Races down to fine leg
good length just outside off, tails into the batsman's body and he defends with a soft bottom hand. Calls early to get off the mark
slower ball on middle stump, defended to mid on
slow once again, back of a length outside off, Chandimal patiently defends off his back foot
