good length on middle and leg, tries to glance that down the leg side but takes his pad instead. Sarfraz has to field that, allowing the batsmen to run
yorker on off stump, squeezed away to gully
yorker on leg stump, somehow manages to get bat to ball from outside leg stump. Dribbles away to mid on
full on middle stump, tapped to midwicket for one
Reverse sweep from Rangana! It's full outside off and the batsman is quick to pounce on that. Goes along the ground, and past first slip for more runs
full just outside off, defended off the front foot
full just outside off, gets close to the pitch of the ball and plays with soft hands towards point. Quick call for one
good length just outside off, dances down the wicket and punches straight to mid off
good length on middle stump, gets to the pitch of the ball by charging down and then drives to long on
tossed up on leg stump, driven to wide of mid on

back of a length just outside off stump, Herath cannot resist the reverse sweep but this time there's some extra bounce and the ball jumps in the air after striking him somewhere near his arm. It pops up and legslip runs three paces to his back to take the catch. Umpire Llong raises his finger for the catch. Herath reviews. The third umpire says it's out too. Yasir Shah falls on his back in a celebratory manner after taking his first wicket in 45 overs. Took the face of the bat's edge before hitting his arm and to the fielder.
full just outside off, takes the inside edge off his defense and flies towards midwicket
short on middle, slight legspin, defended towards short leg off his back foot
fuller on off stump, too close to his body for him to time that cut shot at all
back of a length on off stump, spins away from the right hander, allowing him to free his arms. Pulled to cow corner
back of a length on middle, bunted back to the bowler
good length on middle, defended
back of a length on middle stump, rocks back and punches off the back foot. Goes past cover and point
full on off stump, gets to the pitch of the ball and caressed to long off
full just outside off, defended off the front foot
fuller on middle and leg, raps him on the pads as he tries to defend. Loud appeal, but turned down. Was going down leg
full on middle, defended with the straight bat

tossed up full on middle and leg, Chandimal can't resist the heave and he connects, somewhat. Goes over midwicket and falls safe near the boundary in front of cow corner. And that's 150 for Chandimal.
full on off stump, opens the bat's face and lets the turning ball hit his blade
full just outside off, drifts into Chandimal, defended
short and wide outside off, cut straight to cover
full on leg stump, worked straight to midwicket. And that's Tea.
short and wide outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, poked to point
good length at off stump, down the track to meet it at the pitch and drive to long-off
back of a length and in at leg stump, catches him on the pad as he looks to flick
length at middle stump, steps down and pokes it back to the bowler
short and wide, cut hard past extra cover. Sweeper runs a long way to his right
back of a length, in at leg stump. Whipped to square leg
length at off stump, goes down the track and pushes to mid-on
offcutter, good length at off stump. Watches it onto the bat, rolls his wrists, gets it down to fine leg
that looks plumb. But it also sounded like there was an inside edge. Length ball strikes him above the knee on his back pad as he swats wildly at this. No edge on the replay. Good decision
back of a length outside off, a belated poke at it with a flourish. Results in a thick outside edge. Only one slip in the cordon
and he better hide. Because he has overcompensated and bowled this full and into the pads. Sandakan doesn't understand the fuss about this wicket. Flicks it fine and now has eight off two
back of a length outside off, bunted into the covers off the back foot
length at off stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length outside off, whips aerially against the turn, down to long-on
back of a length outside off, chopped to cover point off the back foot
good length outside off, beaten as he stretches forward
dropped short on middle stump, swivels and goes too hard on the pull shot. Cops it on the thigh guard

bowled him! But it's a no-ball! Oh Sarfraz looks away. Behind, at no one. In annoyance. Chandimal steps out at this length ball, that smashes into middle stump. He was looking to smash it over midwicket and looked quite unruly. Survives
good length at middle stump, solidly defended this time
offcutter, good length at middle stump. Defended into the midwicket
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep square

this is dead in front. At first glance anyway. Full and swinging into leg stump. He looks to flick and is caught on the front pad. Looks close on the replay, but it can't be overturned anyway, they're out of reviews.
bowled! Middle stump again. Full, swinging in and it looks sensational as it sneaks through Pradeep's defence. Abbas will be on a hat-trick the next time he bowls
shapes it in at middle stump, back of a length. Masood closes the face early and gets a leading edge. Sent back after taking off for a run
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot

back of a length at middle stump, times this back foot push nicely. It runs past mid-on...where Herath gives chase and makes him struggle on the second run. Hesitated for about three seconds before coming back for it
length ball wide outside off, left alone
back of a length on the pads, tucked past square leg
back of a length, slanted across off stump. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended to point off the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, dabs it into the covers with soft hands and takes off
good length in the corridor, defended back down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, pushed to short extra off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pushed to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, defended from the crease
well played, but finds square leg. Short one doesn't quite rise, he pulls it elegantly, into the turf
length and into middle stump, flicked to long leg
back of a length into the body, turned to fine leg with the angle
good length, into middle stump. Watchfully poked past midwicket who has to chase after his slide fails
good length at off stump, solidly behind the line to defend
short and wide outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, inside edge onto the boot as he defends
back of a length in the corridor, shuffles and defends to cover
short and wide outside off, nicely timed slice but backward point's dive saves the four
good length in the corridor, defended down the pitch
full outside, nice big stride to get to it. Drives through the line. Not out of the middle but it's got enough to run away to the long-off boundary

hesitation again and this time he's forced to dive. Length ball from around the wicket. Smothers the bounce and does really well to drop it into the leg side. But then he took off without calling - or, in fact, waiting for a call. Square leg was onto it quickly and couldn't hit the stumps
length outside off stump, tapped into the covers and this time they agree - there's a run. And they take it
back of a length at off stump, pushed through the covers off the back foot
good length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket who slides to his right
good length, wide outside off, makes him chase and beats the outside edge
back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point
full at middle stump from around the wicket, defended off the inside edge
good length outside off, slight turn away. Pushes away from the body on the front foot
full and into the leg stump, pushed towards midwicket
good length at off stump, nicely forward to defend to extra cover
flat, good length, and down leg side. Slides through and he gets enough bat on it to get it down towards the fine leg boundary
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
A big no ball to start off. Full outside off stump and left alone
back of a length way outside off, shoulders his arms
short outside off, slightly into the left hander. Just pushes at it off the back foot and flies past point
short outside off, but no bounce this time. Defended off the back foot from near his body

dropped? Swings into the left-hander after pitching full outside off, brings out the drive from the batsman, and takes the outside edge. Flies to gully's left but falls short of him. The Sri Lanka fielders look disappointed, though
full outside off, driven to cover off the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, rises onto him as he defends it after getting onto his toes
full outside off, defended
full outside off and spins into the batsman, charges and drives on the up. Falls just short of Herath at mid on
full on middle stump, prods forward and defends with soft hands
tossed up full on leg stump, straightened after pitching and defended
full on off stump, charges down the pitch and caresses the drive past short cover and mid off for four
full on off stump, defended
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, defended off his back foot
short outside off, punched to mid off
back of a length outside off, drops his hands as he watches the ball before defending
back of a length outside off stump, defended off the back foot towards point
fuller outside off, angling into the left hander, but he shoulders arms
short on middle, worked off his hips to midwicket
full outside off, charges down and inside edges his defense
tight line outside off stump, spins slightly away as he brings down the straight bat
full on middle stump, clipped off his toes to midwicket. But straight to the fielder
short outside off, room to cut it but can't generate enough pace. Straight to point
full just outside off, defended
good length just outside off, stays slightly as he looks to defend. Takes the outside edge but goes to second slip along the ground
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot and calls early for one.
full on middle, gets inside the line of the ball and whips it off his pads past mid on's left. Well timed.
short outside off, stays low and defended
full outside off, low once again as he defends that towards point with soft hands
full on off stump and driven to mid off. And that's drinks.
Full on off stump, and spins slightly away from the left hander. The batsman was flummoxed as he played the defense down the wrong line
full on off once again, this time Aslam can defend it convincingly
back of a length outside off and he extends his arms before sweeping that from outside off and into the leg side. Not  at all timed well, but enough gaps there to earn some easy runs
full on middle and leg, comfortably defended off towards mid on
back of a length on off stump, shuffles to his left before defending that off the back foot
tossed up on middle, charges down and defends
full outside off, the bowler uses the width of the crease to get the angle in. The batsman was up to the challenge: defended off the back foot
good length just outside off, punched off his back foot to short cover
back of a length outside off, gets into the line of the ball and works it behind backward square
good length just outside off, prods forward and defends off his front foot
pitched in short outside off and Aslam swivels early to get into position. Pulled over the square-leg umpire's head but there's protection at the deep
back of a length just outside off stump, punched from top of off stump and they take off quickly for the run
good length on middle and leg, was going down the leg side as the batsman got his bat to it. Worked to backward square. Needs to hurry! But makes the one easily

another chance! It's full on middle stump and Aslam charges down the wicket to slog it over midwicket. The bat turns, and he can't time it well either. Goes just past the short-leg fielder waiting to pounce
full outside off, no spin and defended easily
full just outside off, spins slightly away from the left hander, defended off the front foot
full on middle, gets his back foot out of the way to generate extra power, but can't place the shot well enough. Straight back to the bowler, who throws it back quickly to the keeper
back of a length on off stump, offspin, defended back to the bowler off the back foot
tossed up full on off stump, Aslam chooses to defend that with soft hands
full on off stump, puts his front foot forward and defends from top of his head
back of a length on leg stump, tucked to short fine leg
full on off stump, defended with ease off the front foot
short on off and spins wide away from the left hander, cuts the ball that stays slightly low. Goes to point
full on middle stump, rocks back and whips it towards midwicket
full just outside off and Aslam was waiting to play the paddle. Gets into position early and works that fine behind on the leg side. Flies past short fine leg and after that there was no stopping
full outside off, no spin and Aslam dances down the wicket. Thwacks that over the bowler's head, in a very controlled manner, and that goes one-bounce for four to the long-on boundary
back of a length on middle, raises the back leg and works it to the sweeper on the leg side

Now Masood joins in! Full outside off and he pounces on that quickly. Races down the wicket, using his feet to get to the full pitch of the ball and sends that over the bowler's head once again. Completely in control. Also the 50-run partnership for the openers.
full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
full just outside off, left alone by the batsman
full just outside off stump, sharp spin away from the left hander with the new ball, left alone
flighted on off stump, defended with soft hands. Gets to the pitch of the delivery
full on off stump, anticipates no turn and paddles that to the leg side. Sweeper-fielder retrieves
back of a length and quick outside off stump, hurries Masood's cut shot. Can't time well
full outside off, gives the ball a big rip, spins away from the batsman. Shoulders his arms
full outside off, tries to defend but it hits his pad instead, given there was no turn this time. He played down the wrong line but impact was outside off stump. Sandakan gives you a soft appeal
full on off stump, bunted down the ground to long on for one
full on leg stump, tapped to short leg's boot
full on leg stump, played towards short leg once again
full outside off, driven back to Herath

full outside off and straightens after pitching. Plays down the wrong line and goes past his outside edge but the keeper is quick to remove the bails as the batsman lunged forward. Time for the third umpire. No, he's safe, got his foot back just in time
tossed up full outside off, driven down the ground to long on. He will retain strike
full just outside off, bat turns in his hand as he defends that towards cover
full on middle stump, googly from Sandakan. Bounces higher than normal this time and raps his pad. But it would've gone down the leg side
shuffles back, going deep into his crease and cuts the short and wide ball away past the point region. Got into position early
gives the ball a big rip as it falls full just outside off, defended once again
flatter, short on middle, punched back to Sandakan
full just outside off, flighted. Defended off the front foot
full on off stump, defended back to Herath
full on off stump, lunges forward and defends that with soft hands
full just outside off, Aslam looks happy to see Herath's bowling off with the defense
tossed up full on leg stump, gets his back foot out of the way and bunts it to mid on
full on middle stump, closes the bat's face as he works it towards the leg side
full on off stump, races down the pitch before driving past cover
full outside off, tries to play the big drive but can't get bat to ball

short and wide outside off but it's the wrong'un. The batsman can't pick that and was playing the cut hoping for the stock ball. Comes into him instead and the batsman finds himself in all sort of a tangle
full on off stump, prepares for the paddle shot early as he works it to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
pushes it wide outside off once again, and it's the googly once more. That wide line is a giveaway for the wrong'un. Unconvincingly defended
full outside off, left alone
full just outside off, prods forward and fends

full just outside off stump, gets into position to play the paddle sweep but misses the line this time. Raps him on the pad instead and the keeper gives out a loud appeal! But inside-edge onto the pads
full outside off, spins sharply into the left hander, pads it
full on off stump, defended off the front foot
pushed wide outside off stump, loopy delivery. Aslam comes down the pitch and gets bat-pad to it. Goes close to the ball's pitch to negate any extra spin
full on off stump, pushed to cover
full on off stump, defended back to Herath
misses the paddle sweep from outside off, hits the pad but it was outside the line
full on off stump, pushed to mid off
full outside off, googly this time and it takes the bat's inside edge. Could've easily gone straight to short leg
another googly, good length outside off and spins into the batsman's body. Tried the cut but was too close to play it, went just pat his blade's edge
full on middle stump, googly once again but goes down the leg side as it stays low. Byes
Full on off stump, defended off the back foot. And that's stumps!
good length at middle stump, nudged wide of mid-on
oh dangerous shot. No feet, chases outside off and dabs this length ball to point. Way away from the body
well bowled. Draws him forward this time, in the corridor. He fends at it again, away from the body, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length outside off, keeps low as he looks to cut. Edged into the turf in front of second slip
129 kph, good length, in the corridor, defended to point
129 kph, good length, angled across off. Left alone
back of a length outside off, gets deep in the crease and punches firmly. Extra cover dives to his right
full outside off, nicely forward to defend
full in the corridor, defended to extra cover
pushes one through and catches the pad, but this was going down leg. He was looking to whip it fine off the back foot
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, gets right down and uses a big swing to find deep square with the sweep
full on middle stump, tapped back down the pitch
overpitched outside off, short stride to get to the pitch and a controlled drive wide of mid-off
good length in the channel, lifts off the pitch as he lets it go
good length, in the corridor, left alone
good length, angled across the stumps, left alone
length, in the corridor, left alone
short and down leg side, keeps low as he looks to swipe it to the long leg fence. He can't connect as a result
good length outside off, forward defence
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended off the inside half
length at off stump, solidly behind it to defend
full outside off, looks to sweep. Pre-meditated. This wasn't the ball for that. Sneaks under this shot and rises as it turns to beat the keeper. Held on by slip
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
back of a length, in the corridor, left alone
length, pitching outside off, angling away. Left alone
good length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
good length in the corridor, angling in at him. He defends solidly to cover
length and fired in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full outside off stump, nice connection on the cover drive, but it's straight to the fielder
full at off stump, driven straight to mid-off
short and wide outside off, slapped firmly. Finds extra cover again
good length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide, cuts straight to cover point

wrong'un! Not picked. He didn't pick it all of last evening. This one is slightly short and ripping in at off stump. Just enough time for him to adjust and keep it out on the back foot after shaping to cut
good length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, might have been a cutter. It dips on the keeper as he lets it go

they've run four. It's a full ball at middle stump. He pushes it to mid-on and looks to take on Rangana Herath. They haven't scored in four overs. Herath does superbly to swoop down on it and unleash a throw that would have had him in trouble if he had hit the stumps. But in the end he misses and the backing up isn't good enough
length outside off stump, left alone
good length outside off stump, defended on the front foot with an open face
nips back in from outside off, and nearly takes the off stump. A brave leave from Aslam
oh glorious shot. Finally finds the gap there. This is tossed up outside off and after many balls of finding extra cover, he beats him with a nice swing
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off, driven to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, defended watchfully off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
tossed up outside off, pushed into the covers
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
good length at off stump, dabs it with soft hands past the non-striker and steals the single
good length outside off, leans in to defend it
good length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, behind the line, defended into the covers
full at middle stump, flicked to deep square leg
wrong'un catches him off guard again. Shuffles across, pushes it into the leg side off the back foot. One of these will be fuller and he'll be in trouble
good length outside off, driven to short extra
there it is. Wrong'un, tossed up outside off. Not picked. Stretches forward to defend and cops it on the front pad. Luckily for him, there was an inside edge first
full at middle stump, driven to mid-on
short and wide outside off, cut off the toe-end to deep extra
another wrong'un. Picks it this time, but not the most convincing answer. Walks across his stumps and offers a half shot. Struck on the pad
ahhhh, offers a bait first up. Length and slightly wide outside off. He thinks about slashing at this and resists the temptation. Left alone
length outside off, goes after it this time, but can't time the drive. Dribbles to mid-off
good length outside off, well across the stumps to get behind it. Defended solidly on the front foot
nice looking drive, but straight to short extra. Chased another wide one
drops it short on middle stump, and he transfers the weight behind so quickly. Brings the bat down nicely and looks elegant as he dispatches this pull shot
good length outside off, defended into the off side and quickly through for the single
nice loopy 'lollipop', wide outside off. Only two things to do - get to the pitch, connect well. He does both, sends it to the extra cover boundary
full outside off, tapped off the toe-end to extra cover
wrong'un, goes wrong.Starts on leg, spins further down
oh sweet. That's a shot worthy of getting you to a landmark. A half-century in this case. Overpitched outside off, holds his balance and caresses it wide of mid-off
wrong'un, good length, leg stump. Spins down leg and he lets it
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, tapped back down the pitch
good length outside off, defends from inside the line
length at off stump, down the track, taps it to short midwicket
good length, pushed flat at off stump. Hangs in the crease, flicked to deep square
good length outside off, defended to extra cover

dropped at slip. Plays inside the line as he defends. This one goes straight through outside off and it's a thin edge. Dickwella can't really react and he might have got a glove on it - in fact, it's off his thigh - to distract Karunaratne at slip, who is hurried as he spots this late. Grabs at it to his right and can't hold on.
length outside off, dabbed into the covers with soft hands
full at off stump, mistimed drive to mid-off
good length, wide outside off, left alone
short one climbing away from off stump. He gets under it as he looks to hook. Aerial, but it's wide of deep square. Safe shot in the end, no one in that region. Brings up the 100 stand
bouncer at middle stump, but too short. Ducks under it comfortably
short and in the corridor, gets on top of the bounce and defends into the turf
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full at off stump, flicked to short midwicket
full at middle stump, skips down the track and pokes it to deep midwicket
big appeal for lbw but he was struck outside. Looks to sweep this from well outside off. Gets too far across and misses it.
back of a length at middle stump, nudged to short leg off the back foot
good length outside off, pushed to mid-off
short and well wide outside off stump, shapes to cut, decides against it. Lets it go
back of a length outside off, dabbed into the turf as he tries to steal a single
good length, angled away from off stump, left alone
good length, in the channel, defended to short extra
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length outside off, taps it point on the up
length at off stump, forward block
length at middle, flicked to short midwicket
full outside off, driven back down the pitch
length at middle stump, steps down, drives to long-on
beaten on the outside edge. Back of a length outside off, skids through straight and past his defence
good length outside off, defended into the off side
full outside off, driven to extra cover off the toe-end
nicely played. Good length at middle stump, taps it on the up to get it wide of mid-on, where Herath dives awkwardly to his left and parries it wider. Deep midwicket cleans up
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
bouncer at middle stump, ducks it
good length, angled across off stump from wide of the crease. Flies through at shin height and drops way in front of the keeper
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
tossed up at middle stump, steps out and whips it wide of long-on
back of a length at off stump, defended to point off the back foot
tossed up at middle, flicked through midwicket
good length outside off, defended to point on the front foot
length outside off, drops it in front of point with soft hands
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length, at off stump. Keeps low as he goes on the back foot. Manages to dig it out to midwicket
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, steps out and drives to mid-on to steal a single
good length, leg stump. Defended to short leg
back of a length at off stump, wriggles to adjust for the turn and push this behind point off the outside edge. That's his fifty.
full outside off, steps out, pushes it back to the bowler
full at middle stump, gets down and laps it to long leg with some control
good length outside off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side
length, pushed through flat at off stump, defended into the off side
edge falls short. Good length outside off, plays inside the line again on the push

good length outside off, looks to sweep and gets an inside edge onto pad that rolls to where backward short leg would've been. He takes off for the run that isn't there. Walks  back lazily to make the crease as Karunaratne scampers from slip and hits the stumps direct. Referred upstairs. He's in

saved by the bat. Or is he? This skids through from back of a length and thuds into his pad in front of middle stump as he gets on the back foot. Plumb if there's no edge on it. Umpire has said not out. Chandimal reviews. He has walked well across the stumps....and replays show it is pad first. He's a long way across and I can see leg stump on the replay as this strikes the pad. Impact just in line of off stump. Only just. Would have been umpire's call if it was a centimeter to the right. But it isn't. He's trapped and he's out. Decision overturned.
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot

another review. He's been given out, trapped on the back foot. This one skid through as well, from a good length. Azhar had shuffled and was struck in front of off stump. Ultra Edge shows a disturbance when the ball passes the bat. Azhar didn't seem like he thought there was an inside edge, so this is strange. It will be overturned. Very very weird.
on the front foot straight away. Steps out and plays very close to the body as he defends into the off side
full at off stump, driven to mid-on
good length at off stump, defended off the inside half
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
full at middle stump, to the pitch, driven to long-on
good length at off stump, defended from the crease
full outside off, driven to short extra cover
tossed up outside off, nicely to the pitch. Driven firmly to extra cover
good length, pushed through quick. Defended off the inside half of the bat
good length at leg stump, down the track to push this to midwicket
what a ball. Is this the first sign of the pitch changing? This is pitches on off stump and zips away to beat batsman and keeper.
full at middle stump, strikes the pad as he looks to flick. Sliding down, not out
length at off stump, steps out and hurriedly pokes it back to the bowler
full on middle, defended down the pitch
length outside off, defended to extra cover after stepping out. Dickwella appeals. Like he does.
length outside off, gets down and paddles it fine
full outside off, defended down the pitch

bowled him! Dreadful shot. One of many pre-meditated sweep shots and he's succumbed to the pressure. A tiring, slow session has suddenly turned fruitful for Sri Lanka. This was slow, tossed right up at middle stump. He'd been flicking this for the most part, but now he exposes the stumps, and plonks his leg across to the off side. The ball is well away from where his foot is. He's locked and he can't get low because of the line. Hands come down late, ball sneaks under the bat and leg stump is tonked
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
good length, spinning in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
skips down, meets the length ball outside off, drives to mid-on
good length outside off, pushes forward and defends
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length outside off, defended down the pitch
good length outside off, defended off the outside half.
good length outside off, defended into the off side
full outside off, mistimed drive to extra over
rapped on the pad but no appeal from the experienced man. This was an arm ball, going down leg as Shafiq pressed forward
length at off stump, defended
good length at off stump, another arm ball. Defended solidly this time
tossed up at off stump, driven to short extra
full at off stump, driven to mid-on
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the front foot
full at off stump, driven to mid-on
good length outside off, inside edge onto pad as he defends
good length outside off, defended from the crease
nicely played. Tossed right up outside off, hint of drift away. But he gets to the pitch and pushes this through the covers
back of a length, skidding into leg stump. Looks to whip of the back foot, gets an inside edge that rolls through the short fine region
full outside off, driven back at the bowler
good length outside off, steps out and dabs to midwicket
overpitched outside off, gets in line and drills this through the covers
full at leg stump, defended down the pitch
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
good length at middle stump, watchfully defended
back of a length at middle stump, pushed off the back foot
full toss on leg stump, sweeps it straight to short fine. Attemtped wrong'un
full at off stump, drives with the turn to mid-on
full at middle stump, solidly defended back to the bowler

wrong'un beats him outside off and there's a big stumping appeal. He pushed forward was beaten. This is very close on the replay. He has stretched out well in front and on first glance, there appears to be nothing behind the crease. A shadow creeps behind the crease, but no tangible evidence of boot. Super close. I wonder if he'll get the benefit of doubt. Several angles tried and now the zoom-in...if he has anything in, it's an inch of rubber. And because of the doubt, he will survive.
full just outside off, spins into Azhar as he drives to mid on
full on off stump, worked towards midwicket and calls early for the single
back of a length on middle stump, spins into his body and cramps his pull. Can't get bat to ball
full on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length just outside off, tries to cut but takes the bottom edge and just past his stumps
full on leg stump, tucked off his pads to backward square
full just outside off, just a gentle push off the front foot and it goes past cover's right. Eased into that shot
back of a length just outside off, defended off his back foot. Was early to get behind the line of the ball
back of a length just outside off, shoulders his arms
good length just outside off, prods forward to defend but takes the inside edge as the ball flies to the leg side
back of a length just outside off, defended off the front foot. Solid technique

back of a length on middle stump, tries to tuck that to fine leg but raps him on the pads instead. A weak appeal for lbw (it was going down the leg side anyway), before the batsmen scamper through for legbyes
full outside off, drives extravagantly but straight to cover
back of a length on middle and leg, spins into his body as he shuffles and whips that off his hips to the sweeper on the leg side
back of a length outside off stump, straightens after pitching and allows Azhar to get behind the ball's line and carve it off the back foot past point
fullish just outside off, stays low as the batsman bunts it back to the bowler
full just outside off, defended back to Lakmal
full on middle stump, driven along the ground to mid on
full just outside off, and tails into the batsman. Driven on the up but straight to mid off. Late swing in
good length just outside off, Azhar taps that back to the bowler off the back foot. Solid
full just outside off, tries to defend that with soft hands but inside edges the ball onto his pad
pitched short outside off but lesser pace (124 kph) this time. Stays expectedly low as Azhar defends with ease
good length on middle, glances the ball down to fine leg after shuffling towards the off side
full wide outside off, left alone by Shafiq.
full just outside off, driven down the ground to the bowler, who dives to his right and stops the run
full on middle, gets his back foot out of the way and uses his wrists to whip that towards the leg side. Goes to sweeper for one
short on middle stump, rocks back and displays the full face of the bat as he punches it back to Sandakan
back of a length on leg stump, spins further away towards the leg side and the batsman tries to tuck that fine

full outside off stump, it's the googly! Stays low, and the batsman has to reach for the cut shot. It's mistimed and goes past gully for some more runs. The ball was shin-high, when he played the shot
drift in the air, good length just outside off but spins further away courtesy the googly. Collected wide outside off by the keeper
full just outside off, driven on the up to mid off
full on off stump, stays low once again and hurries the batsman to get bat to ball. Does well to make contact, or else it would've rapped him on the pads in front of the wicket
back of a length just outside off, driven to short cover, who does well to get his body behind the ball
back of a length outside off, gets his feet outside the off-side line and defends that with the bat's open face. Bat-pad
back of a length on off stump, rocks back and defends that off his back foot
full on off stump, tails slightly in, plays the on drive to midwicket
full on off stump and Shafiq gets down on one knee and slogs that over midwicket's head for four. Got into position early as he played it with the spin
good length outside off, no spin this time as he cuts that late past gully after rocking back deep into the crease
full just outside off, gets to the pitch of the delivery and defends that with soft hands
full on middle and leg, sees the ball through as he turns the blade, tucked to midwicket
full on off stump, driven straight down the ground to Sandakan
full just outside off, stays low and it's the wrong'un as well. Cut square
full outside off, sees the first ball out with a front-foot defense
well fielded by short cover. Full on off stump, and charges down the ground to drive that square, but the fielder dived to his right
full on middle, charges down and defends straight back to Herath
full on off stump, tentatively puts his stride in and defends it just past the poaching silly point
full on off stump, defended close to the ground with soft hands.
full on off stump, driven square and he makes good contact but Thirimanne at extra cover does well to ensure that does not go for a boundary. Stops that powerful shot
full on off stump, worked towards the leg side but not enough power. Dribbles away to midwicket
full on off stump, no spin as it's driven down the ground to mid on
full on off stump, turns slightly into the right hander, who works it off his toes to midwicket
sharp turn and shouts of catch it! Full on off, courtesy the big rip he gives the ball, and it turns sharply after pitching. Struck him on the pads, and short leg attempts a catch. Goes just past him
full on middle, defended with soft hands
full outside off, gets inside the line of the ball before playing the on drive. But straight to midwicket once again
full on off stump, Shafiq brings out the front-foot defense
full on leg stump as the batsman charges down the wicket. Herath might've seen the batsman's charge and pushed it wide. Pads it
full on middle, dances down the wicket and tries to defend. Hits him on the pads once again, but going down leg
good length on off, defended
full on middle and leg, a loopy delivery. All Shafiq can do is defend. Full face of the bat, though
full just outside off, defended with the bat's open face.
full on leg stump, worked past short leg
back of a length on middle stump, sharp spin and Azhar gets his blade down in time to work that towards the leg side. Short leg anticipates and fields that beautifully
full just outside off, defended
back of a length on off stump, rocks back and defends it off the back foot. Extravagant feet movement
charges down the wicket and turns that towards the leg side. It was full outside off and it's played on the up. Shouts of 'catch it' as the ball flies past midwicket's right
full  just outside off, defended with soft hands to ensure the ball stays along the ground
looped on middle stump back of a length, defended towards the leg side by closing the face of the bat
full on middle stump, firm defense off the front foot
full outside off, plays the predetermined paddle sweep. Goes only to backward square
back of a length on middle stump, tucks it fine off his hips to short fine leg
full on off stump, defended off the front foot
tossed up full on middle, drives that down the ground past Herath but it can only go as far as to mid off
full just outside off, gets inside the ball's line and drives that on the on side. Goes to mid on's right
full on off stump, works it towards the leg side but there's a short mid on for that shot
full outside off and goes straight this time, he plays for the spin, but there wasn't any. Goes straight on, and takes the outside edge of his poking bat. Goes juuust past first slip's right
back of a length outside off, sharp turn into the batsman. Punched to short cover
full on leg stump, tucked to backward square and calls early
full on leg stump, and goes past his leg side. Dickwella thinks the batsman got an edge to it. He appeals loudly, and the captain contemplates taking a review, but he decides otherwise.
full on off, driven down the ground past short cover, who gets a finger to reduce the shot's speed. Mid off cleans up
full on off stump, driven and takes the outside edge. Rolls along the ground to first slip
defended off the back foot, back of a length on off stump
full on off stump, driven down the ground but straight to mid off

slower ball, and looped up too. Shafiq is quick to gauge the length. He gets a big stride forward and sweeps that square past the two infielders on the leg side for four. A beautiful shot, that reminds Varun of the Younis-sweep
full on middle, defended towards the leg side
back of a length just outside off, signs of reverse swing. Good carry through to the keeper as the batsman shoulders his arms
back of a length just outside off, sharp reverse swing but the batsman had covered the line in front of the stumps as he shoulders his arms
short outside off, tiptoes and taps that square on the off side. Big gaps in that region behind square as the sweeper-fielder retrieves
back of a length but wide outside off, stays low and the batman chooses to let that go
short just outside off, forces Shafiq to duck.
full outside off but angles in sharply with the reverse swing. Uses the width of the crease to get that angle, and the defensive shot is inside edged onto his pads
tossed up full outside off, charges down the pitch and drives. But straight to short cover
full on middle, drifting down the legside as he tucks it past short fine leg
full outside off, driven to short cover
full outside off, driven extravagantly. Goes straight to extra cover
full just outside off, biffed to mid on off the front foot
back of a length just outside off, courageous stuff from Azhar to let that go. Goes just past the off stump as the keeper collects
length ball on off stump, swings into the right hander, allowing him to work that off his pads to the sweeper fielder on the leg side.

back of a length outside off, sharp angle back into the batsman and another courageous leave by the batsman. Could've easily angled back slightly more and taken the top of off stump. But instead goes through to the keeper
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to short cover

This time Azhar almost pays the price. Back of a length once again and this time comes in enough to cramp Azhar. Forced to play a shot, and his punch inside edges onto his pads. Could've easily played on
back of a length outside off, Azhar drops his knees and gets out of the delivery's way
full on leg stump, Azhar tries to whip that fine on the leg side but can't make contact. The keeper has to get onto his knees to field that as the ball goes down leg
full on off stump, tossed up, and carefully defended off the front foot
short outside off, rocks back and cuts square but straight to the fielder at point
back of a length on off stump, sharp offspin that hits Shafiq above his pads as he tried to glance that down the leg side
good length on off and middle, defended off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, goes deep into the crease and tucks it square on the leg side. There's a sweeper-fielder for that shot
tossed up full on leg stump, closes the bat's face to play that towards midwicket

short outside off, hits the deck hard and the ball comes into the right-hander, very sharply. Shoulders his arms as the ball goes past him outside the off stump. Good carry to the keeper. Clearly bending his back while bowling
back of a length wide outside off, but swings in and left alone by the batsman once again. Using the scrambled seam
short outside off stump, forces Shafiq to tiptoe and defend that with soft hands from near his chest

back of a length outside off, this time he calculates the swing and gets behind the ball's line and punches that past cover and point for a beautiful uppish drive. Calls early for three, but oh no, they will run four! Kaushal Silva, in the deep, tries to throw it in, but it was lobbed over the second-fielder who was there to help him. Allows time for one more run
full on off stump, driven down the ground to mid on
back of a length just outside off, swings into him as he defends it off his front foot to see the over out

full just outside off, biffed down the ground, and past the diving bowler to mid on. The bowler's dive may have slightly distracted the non-striker, forcing the batsman to return to his crease after calling for a single
full on leg stump, defended back to Dilruwan
loopy on middle stump, no turn and the batsman dances down the wicket. Driven straight to mid on, but calls early for the run
full on middle stump, dug out and goes straight towards short midwicket, who dives to his left to stop the ball. Does well
full on off stump, driven to mid off but not timed well

back of a length on middle, minimal footwork back as he cuts the ball to point, but it was too close to his body. Plays it from top of middle stump, and because he played the shot so close to his body, Shafiq could not get the direction he wanted on that shot
loose delivery to start off, full toss wide outside off, the batsman chases at it, and muscles that towards deep extra cover. That deserved more runs, though

wide outside off and sharp spin into middle stump, but Shafiq was quick to get deep into his crease and punched that in front of square past cover's left as the ball races away to the extra cover boundary
full just outside off, sharp spin into the right hander, defended with soft hands

charges and dispatches that! The bowler pushed it wide, perhaps seeing the batsman charge, but Shafiq was up to the task. Gets to the pitch of the ball and hoicks that over mid on's head for four. Goes one-bounce into the rope
full on off stump, tucked to the leg with the help of Sandakan's spin
full on middle stump, the batsman looked like he was in two minds on where to play that. Spins sharply into him, and raps his pad but it would've gone down leg. No shot offered.
full on leg stump, tapped towards the sweeper-fielder on the leg side. Military medium at best
wide outside off, rocks back and cuts to point's right
full on leg stump, drifting down leg and tucked to fine leg at the deep
full on leg stump, worked off his pads to the sweeper fielder on the leg side. Easy singles in that region.
back of a length just outside off, defended with soft hands off the back foot
somewhat of an arm ball to finish the over, back of a length just outside off and punched back to the bowler.
yorker on off stump, bunted back to the bowler
full outside off, stays slightly low as it is unconvincingly driven towards short cover
full on leg stump, driven straight to short mid on
full on middle and leg, prods forward to defend at it but takes the inside edge towards short leg
back of a length on middle stump, rocks back and works that towards the leg side
full on middle stump, defended with soft hands as the ball goes along the ground
full just outside off, driven on the up, but straight to short cover
full on middle, slight spin into the batsman's body. Closes the bat's face to defend that towards the leg side
back of a length on middle stump, no real pace to bother the set batsman, goes deep into his crease and punches that back past the bowler and to mid on
full on off stump, good technique to get to the ball's pitch and defend that from as low as possible
full on off stump, it's the wrong'un but the batsman picks it up. Defended
full on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
full on leg stump, glanced towards midwicket on the leg side
full on middle, premeditated paddle sweep. Gets his front foot forward and opens the bat's blade towards short fine leg. Not enough runs earned for the effort put
back of a length on middle, punched off the back foot to cover
short outside leg stump, spins further away as the ball goes down the leg side
good length just outside off, defended back to the bowler after Shafiq adjusts for the spin
full on off stump and Shafiq frees his arms to drive that but can't get the sweet connection he was looking for. Goes to mid off
full on middle stump, tucked off his hips to the sweeper fielder on the leg side. Azhar wanted the second, but Shafiq says nope
very full on off stump, Shafiq almost pays the price for the premeditation. Eventually swept to backward square, but rather uncomfortably
full on middle, worked off his toes towards midwicket
full on middle and off, defended off the front foot after prodding forward
